Name: Archibald's Last Memory
Ingredients: 60 ml Straight rye whiskey (100 proof /50% alc./vol.)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill an Old-fashioned glass .
Prepare garnish of orange zest twist.
STRAIN into chilled glass (no ice in glass).
EXPRESS orange zest twist over the cocktail and use as garnish.
Review: This drink is so spirituous that it may have finished Archibald off, but at least his last drink was a proper sharpener. Then again, the perceived health-giving herbal benefits of Fernet and Bénédictine combined in such a dosage would have perhaps got him back on his feet. We prefer this cocktail served on-the-rocks as the dilution takes the edge off the spirituous attack and opens the cocktail, releasing more of its delicate herbal complexity.
History: Adapted from a recipe which originated at the Flatiron Lounge in New York City circa 2010.
